title: Career Impact
content: Graduates of the Master of Safety and Risk Engineering program have broad career opportunities in the transportation, energy, manufacturing, and related industries. With expertise in risk analysis, safety planning, and hazard mitigation, graduates often occupy strategic positions as safety managers, risk consultants, or policy developers in government agencies, national companies, and international organizations. The competencies acquired enable graduates to provide innovative solutions to enhance safety standards, reduce operational risks, and support sustainability. With the global demand for professionals skilled in risk management, this program provides a strong foundation for careers in dynamic and complex industries.
